name: 2-3 Moves
description:
You are standing at the point 
    0
 on a coordinate line. Your goal is to
reach the point 
    n
. In one minute, you can move by 
    2
 or by 
    3

to the left or to the right (i. e., if your current coordinate is 
    x
, it
can become 
    x-3
, 
    x-2
, 
    x+2
 or 
    x+3
). Note that the new
coordinate can become negative. Your task is to find the minimum number of
minutes required to get from the point 
    0
 to the point 
    n
. You have
to answer 
    t
 independent test cases. Input The first line of the input
contains one integer 
    t
 (
    1 
    ≤ t 
    ≤ 10^4
) — the number of test
cases. Then 
    t
 lines describing the test cases follow. The 
    i
-th of
these lines contains one integer 
    n
 (
    1 
    ≤ n 
    ≤ 10^9
) — the
goal of the 
    i
-th test case. Output For each test case, print one integer
— the minimum number of minutes required to get from the point 
    0
 to the
point 
    n
 for the corresponding test case. Example Input 4 1 3 4 12 Output
2 1 2 4
